objects.description: * General UX Specs: https://mozilla.box.com/s/y60s1ngyza9jcltmpaqwfoye4f311n5r
objects.name: [System]The lockscreen with passcode should display correctly in RTL

steps.instruction: Set your phone language to Arabic.
Launch Settings -> tap "Screen Lock" and set a passcode.
Press Power key twice to lock screen and light on screen.

steps.expected:
4.1.SIM 1 and SIM 2's operator name should be right-aligned, if there's no SIM card inserted, the text of "Emergency calls only" and "(no SIM)" should be right-aligned with any Arabic labels reading right to left.  
4.2.Time should be right-aligned in RTL. Number generally still run left to right, 24 hour format is favored.    
4.3.The date on lock screen should be right-aligned in RTL. Date formatting for Arabic is day of week, numeric day of month, and name of month from right to left.     
4.4.The Camera icon should be left-aligned.
steps.instruction: Slide screen to enter unlock phone view.

steps.expected:
5.1. When user is typing, the dots are shown in LTR manner because it is numeral, and the dots should be center-aligned in the square.    
5.2.The numeric keyboard should remain the same as that in LTR language, text within "EMERGENCY CALL" and "CANCEL" keys should be center-aligned and read right to left.
steps.instruction: Input the passcode.

objects.name: [Calendar]Add event view should be displayed correctly in RTL language.

steps.instruction: Launch calendar.

steps.expected:
2.1.The header title should be center-aligned with any Arabic reading right to left, the cancel button should be right-aligned and the Save button should be left-aligned.    
2.2.Value selector buttons have right-aligned text that read right to left, number should read left to right, "AM&PM" should displayed at left of time. The triangle icon is left-aligned and mirrored.  
2.3.Hint text in the input  field is right-aligned and read right to left. Avoid italics.  Text typed into an input area should be right-aligned and read right to left. Cursor placement and movement may vary.   
2.4.The toggles should be left-aligned, with ON to the right and OFF to the left, the checkmark is NOT mirrored.   
2.5.Sub-headers should be right-aligned and read right to left.  
2.6.The Arabic question mark should be mirrored but not flipped.    
2.7.Scroll bar should be left-aligned, but still move vertically.    
2.8.Enter enough text in the comments box to make it scrollable, the scroll bar should be left-aligned, but still move vertically.   
2.9.Date should successively show as day, month, year from right to left, the time should read left to right.    
2.10.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.

steps.instruction: Open browser and then go to "http://mozilla-b2g.github.io/qa-testcase-data/manifest.webapp/short_name-support/index.html" page

steps.expected: Install dialog is prompted
steps.instruction: Press "Test - Value of short_name is a number" to test this case

steps.expected: "1234567890 installed" message is prompted.
steps.instruction: Click "Install" to install the test app

steps.expected: Test app is installed and on Homescreen. Its name shown in Homescreen is "1234567890".
steps.instruction: Press home button to Homescreen and move to the bottom of Homescreen.

steps.expected: Test app is launched.
steps.instruction: Click this app

steps.expected: The name shown in Card View is "1234567890"
steps.instruction: Long press home button to launch Task Manager

steps.expected: Its name is "1234567890".
steps.instruction: Go to "Settings>App Permissions" and find the test app

steps.expected: The title is app name "1234567890".
steps.instruction: Click the test app in "App Permissions"

steps.expected: In deleting dialog, make sure the app name is "1234567890".
steps.instruction: click "Uninstall App"

steps.expected: app is removed correctly.
steps.instruction: click "Delete" in deleting dialog.

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).

objects.description: * General UX Specs: https://mozilla.app.box.com/s/y60s1ngyza9jcltmpaqwfoye4f311n5r
objects.name: [Settings]Privacy Controls-> "Guided Tour" pages should be displayed correctly in RTL language.

steps.instruction: Set your phone language to Arabic.
Launch settings app.
Tap "Privacy Controls".
Tap "Guided Tour".

steps.expected:
5.1.The picture should be shown the same as that in LTR language.  
5.2.The description texts should be center-aligned with any Arabic text reading right to left.  
5.3.The text within "Get Started!" button should be center-aligned and read right to left.  
5.4.Page indicator highlighted dot should start from right to left.       
5.5.The cancel button on header should be right-aligned.
steps.instruction: Observe the first page.

steps.expected:
6.1.The picture should be shown the same as that in LTR language.   
6.2.The description texts should be center-aligned with any Arabic text reading right to left.  
6.3.The position of "Next" and "Back" buttons should be swapped, and the texts within the buttons should be center-aligned and read right to left.    
6.4.Page indicator highlighted dot should start from right to left.        
6.5.The cancel button on header should be right-aligned.      
6.6.The question mark should be mirrored but not flipped.
steps.instruction: Observe the 2~9 pages.

steps.expected:
7.1.The picture should be shown the same as that in LTR language.   
7.2.The description texts should be center-aligned with any Arabic text reading right to left.  
7.3.The position of "Finish Tour" and "Back" buttons should be swapped, and the texts within the buttons should be center-aligned and read right to left.    
7.4.Page indicator highlighted dot should start from right to left.   
7.5.The cancel button on header should be right-aligned.    
7.6.The question mark should be mirrored but not flipped.     
7.7.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.
steps.instruction: Observe the last page.

objects.description: * General UX Specs: https://mozilla.app.box.com/s/y60s1ngyza9jcltmpaqwfoye4f311n5r
objects.name: [Settings]Privacy panel-> "Location Accuracy" add exceotions view should be displayed correctly in RTL language.

steps.instruction: Set your phone language to Arabic.
Launch settings app.
Tap "Privacy Controls".
Tap "Location Accuracy".
Enable "Geolocation" and "Location adjustment".

steps.expected:
6.1.The header title should remain the same as that in LTR language with any Arabic text reading right to left, the back button should be right-aligned and mirrored.
6.2.The texts with list items should be right-aligned with any Arabic text reading right to left, the icons of apps should be displayed at right side of app names but not mirrored.     
6.3.The chevron icons should be left-aligned and mirrored.     
6.4.The scrollbar is now left-aligned, but still move vertically.
steps.instruction: Select "Add exceptions".

steps.expected:
7.1.The back button should be right-aligned and mirrored.     
7.2.The texts within list items should be right-aligned with any Arabic text reading right to left.  
7.3.The icon of app should be displayed at right side of app names but not mirrored.   
7.4.Value selector button has right-aligned text that reads right to left. The triangle icon is left-aligned and mirrored.   
7.5.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.
steps.instruction: Tap on one of the listed apps.

steps.expected:
8.1.The title and listed items should be right-aligned and read right to left.   
8.2.The checkmark should be left-aligned but not be mirrored.    
8.3.The text within OK button should be center-aligned.
steps.instruction: Tap the value selector button.

steps.expected: Panels slide in from the right edge of the screen.
steps.instruction: Tap the back button on header.

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).
tags.name: keyboard

Wait for the app usage ping to reach the server

steps.expected: There should be a search count of 1
steps.instruction: Verify the history of search count for each provider is present in the app usage ping

objects.name: [Metrics] Search suggestions does not count as a search

steps.instruction: Open Settings > Search
Enable "Search Suggestions"
Press the rocketbar ("Search the web" on the status bar)
Type "star trek", and wait for the search suggestions to load.
Type "star wars", and wait for the search suggestions to load.
Wait for the app usage ping to reach the server

steps.expected: Search suggestion is not counted as search, so there should be 0 search count
steps.instruction: Verify the search count is 0 in the App Usage ping payload

Chang the system time to yesterday

steps.expected: Should go to Google search (or other default serach provider) with search term "mozilla"

steps.instruction: Wait for another DEFAULT_RETRY_INTERVAL

From a desktop, create/sign in a yahoo email account that has a really long first name and last name.
From that account created on the desktop, send an email to the user's yahoo account that is currently signed in on the dut.
Check the user's inbox on the dut for the email sent in step 3 to make sure that it has been received.
Manually change the date on the dut to a date that is a year from now.
Force close the email app.
Reopen the email app.

steps.instruction: Go to the inbox and look at the sender name and the date for that email sent in step 3.

objects.name: [Calendar]Day view should be displayed correctly in RTL language.

steps.instruction: Set the device language in Arabic.
Launch calendar and create some events.
Select Day tab.

steps.expected:
4.1.The header title should be center-aligned with any Arabic reading right to left exclusive of numerals, the drawer button should be right-aligned and the add button should be left-aligned.       
4.2.List items on Day view should be mirrored: hours are now displayed on the right of screen. Numbers remain the same, however AM and PM should appear at left side of time.   
4.3.The events should be mirrored, the remind icon should be left-aligned and the text should be right-aligned.   
4.4.The colored line in event should be right-aligned. If the event name with long LTR texts, the ellipsis should be shown at right side of text, if the event name with long RTL texts, the ellipsis should be shown at left side of text.    
4.5.The icon with "24" should be right-aligned but not be mirrored.

objects.description: Add this to every TC description: Verify that all strings are translated into the locale you are testing. If you find an untranslated string, look at the same string in a pseudolocale (preferably Accented English). If the string appears in normal English, it is hard-coded and not localizable. File a bug under the "Firefox OS" component and add the keyword "l12y". If the string appears in a pseudolocale, then the localizer hasn't got to it yet. Please don't file a bug.

objects.description: When attempting to share an image via email, with no account set up, the application should display the "New Account" page with a bit of text explaining the situation.
objects.name: All the strings on the "You have not set up an account" blurb are translated correctly without truncation.

steps.instruction: On a phone with no email account set up launch the gallery application with at least one image in it.
Select an image, click the "share" icon and then "email".

The email application should open and display the "New Account" page with an added bit of text saying "You are not set up to send or receive email. Create an account to complete the action". Ensure that this string is translated correctly, not truncated or overlap the UI in any way.

objects.description: All strings on the delete or save draft screen are translated correctly without truncation or any UI overlap
objects.name: All strings on the "Delete Draft" screen are translated correctly without truncation

steps.instruction: On a phone with an email account set up, launch the application.
Create a new email message and then press the arrow in the top left corner of the screen to navigate away from the message screen.
A new page should open asking whether you want to save or delete the draft. Make sure everything is properly translated without truncation or any UI overlap.

objects.name: All strings on the "delete contacts" confirmation screen are translated properly without truncation or UI overlap

steps.instruction: On a phone that has many contacts open the dialer application and select the "Contacts" button. If you're not sure which one that is, it's the one in the bottom middle of the screen and looks like a person.
Click the settings gear in the top right of the screen and select "Delete Contacts".

Pick one contact to delete, press "delete" in the upper right corner and you should see a dialogue window open asking to confirm deletion. Make sure that screen is translated correctly, without truncation or UI overlap. See attachment "2015-09-02-13-13-36.png" for reference.
Repeat step 3 with different numbers of contacts (2, 4, 10, etc), each time making sure that the string is translated correctly, without truncation or UI overlap.

Each time a contact is deleted there should be a popup in the bottom of the Contacts listing that confirms the deletion. make sure that string is translated correctly, without truncation or UI overlap. See attachment 2015-09-02-13-21-44.png for reference

objects.description: Verify that all strings are translated into the locale you are testing. objects.description:
Prerequisite:  
1. Enable Pinning the Web on Settings > Developer
objects.name: [Pin the Web]If an app manifest is provided, the next largest app icon nearest to the (DPPX) x (required size: 72x72) should show on pin site section of pin card

steps.instruction: Go to http://alison-shiue.github.io/with\_manifest/link\_manifest.html, and tap overflow menu(...) -> Pin

steps.expected:
1. For Flame (DPPX 1.5), a bear icon shows correctly  
2. For Aries (DPPX 2.25), an elephant icon shows correctly
steps.instruction: Check the pin site section
